intro: Polymeria, commonly known as the "silverleaf" or "silverbush," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage due to dense covering of fine hairs. The plants typically have small, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to yellow. Polymeria species are often shrubs or subshrubs, growing in rocky or arid environments. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in harsh conditions.
